intro: Touchiroa acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed touchiroa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
